grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 魂胆【コンタン】ulterior motive, plot, scheme, complicated circumstances, intricacies
鎮魂【チンコン】repose of souls
入魂【ニュウコン】putting one's heart and soul into, putting one's all into, intimacy, familiarity
kun reading compounds: 魂不死説【たましいふしせつ】(theory of) the immortality of the soul
一寸の虫にも五分の魂【いっすんのむしにもごぶのたましい】tread on a worm and it will turn, even a tiny bug will defend itself, even the weakest and smallest beings have their own wills, so do not make light of them
魂送り【たまおくり】sending off the spirits of the dead
稲魂【うかのみたま】the god of foodstuffs (esp. of rice)
亡き魂【なきたま】departed soul, spirit
